page.title: 10THE R.U.C. RECREATION CENTRE
page.content: The R.U.C. Recreation Centre The Royal Ulster Constabulary's Recreation Centre is situated in Kilroot near the shore. Formerly the property belonged to I.C.I. but since August 1984 the{R.U.C.}have started to refurnish and decorate the centre. There are only two of these centres in {Northern Ireland,}but this is the main one and it caters for{2,500 people each week. Three people manage the centre and they do a good job. There are{54 acres}of land owned by the centre. Part of this area has been turned into a football pitch and a cricket ground. The centre has numerous facilities, a large hall, a kitchen, a restaurant, a bar, and a lounge. The large hall can seat{250 for a meal and{650}for a concert. The hall can be used as a cinema by putting a large screen on the stage.
